title: Revolutionizing Eggplant Cultivation: The Plastic Pot Method

tasks.task: Selecting and preparing a plastic container for planting eggplants
subtasks: Look for an old plastic container in the house
Ensure the container is at least 10 inches deep
Determine the necessary size based on eggplant variety
Drill drainage holes at the bottom of the container
Fill the container with good quality potting mix rich in organic matter

tasks.task: Planting eggplant seeds in the container
subtasks: Dig a hole about one inch deep in the center of the potting mix
Place the eggplant seed in the hole
Lightly cover the seed with soil
Water the planted seed gently, avoiding dislodgment
Place the container in a warm and sunny location (at least 6 hours of sunlight daily)
Maintain soil moisture without overwatering (soil should be moist, not soggy)
Add organic fertilizer when seedlings reach 3 inches tall
Monitor eggplants for firmness and shine
Harvest eggplants using a sharp knife or scissors, leaving a small stem attached
Confirm harvesting time is 8 to 10 weeks from planting date
Recognize the eco-friendly approach of using old plastic containers
Appreciate the reward of growing homegrown eggplants
